pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with the President of Mexico, Andrés Manuel López Obrador | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke today with Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador about progress towards ratification of the new North American Free Trade Agreement.

The two leaders welcomed the conclusion of the final stage of negotiations and the signing ceremony taking place in Mexico City today, December 10th.

The Prime Minister and the President reaffirmed the importance of strong trade ties between our countries for continued job creation and economic growth, and recognized the progressive nature of the new agreement.

The Prime Minister and the President looked forward to continuing to work closely together for the benefit of people, businesses, and the environment in all three countries and agreed to stay in touch as the new trade agreement makes its way through each country’s legislative process.
